channel.title: Whonix 10 changing from stable to tester socks error
channel.description:

item.title: Whonix 10 changing from stable to tester socks error
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
[quote=“TNT BOM BOM, post:2, topic:1061”]after reboot , to both workstation&gateway , the following message acquired in workstation only by whonixcheck:-

[code]ERROR: Tor Bootstrap Result:
Tor’s Control Port could not be reached!

Troubleshooting:

  • Confirm that Whonix-Gateway is running.
  • Run whonixcheck on Whonix-Gateway and confirm success.
  • If you’re running multiple Whonix-Workstations simultaneously, confirm that separate IP addresses are configured (see https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Multiple_Whonix-Workstations).
  • Rerun whonixcheck here.

(Technical information:)
(Code: 255)
(tor_bootstrap_timeout_type: none)
(tor_bootstrap_status: Socket error: [Errno 111] Connection refused)
(check_socks_port_open_test: 7)
(Tor Circuit: not established)[/code]

but there is a connection , and im browsing the tor browser with no problems.[/quote]

TNT BOM BOM:

btw , with double restarting and checking with the apt-get update in konsole the errors r no more existed (even whonixcheck message) , so its not persistent but it did appear according to what i have done.

That window has a timestamp and content once the whonixcheck window is shown is never changed.

Please do what it recommends. Confirm that Whonix-Gateway is running. Then rerun whonxicheck on the workstation. There should be no issue then.

When you restart Whonix-Workstation while Whonix-Gateway is off or not fully booted up, you’ll see that message. That’s expected. To prevent the message, just start Whonix-Gateway. Wait a few moments. Then start Whonix-Workstation. Then again. When you want to restart both, Whonix-Gateway and Whonix-Workstation, it’s expected to see that message if Whonix-Gateway is not fully booted up.

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix 10 changing from stable to tester socks error

item.title: Whonix 10 changing from stable to tester socks error
item.dc:creator: TNT_BOM_BOM
item.description:
after reboot , to both workstation&gateway , the following message acquired in workstation only by whonixcheck:-

[code]ERROR: Tor Bootstrap Result:
Tor’s Control Port could not be reached!

Troubleshooting:

  • Confirm that Whonix-Gateway is running.
  • Run whonixcheck on Whonix-Gateway and confirm success.
  • If you’re running multiple Whonix-Workstations simultaneously, confirm that separate IP addresses are configured (see https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Multiple_Whonix-Workstations).
  • Rerun whonixcheck here.

(Technical information:)
(Code: 255)
(tor_bootstrap_timeout_type: none)
(tor_bootstrap_status: Socket error: [Errno 111] Connection refused)
(check_socks_port_open_test: 7)
(Tor Circuit: not established)[/code]

but there is a connection , and im browsing the tor browser with no problems.

Read full topic
